channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Iran Accelerates Production of Near-Bomb-Grade Uranium, IAEA Says
item.description: The United Nations chief inspector says production has quadrupled. But it is not clear whether Iran is trying to touch off a crisis or gather bargaini...

item.title: Opposition Grows to South Korea’s President as He Faces Impeachment
item.description: The leader of President Yoon Suk Yeol’s own party has backed impeachment, on which the National Assembly is set to vote on Saturday.

item.title: Is Milk Safe? Your Questions About Bird Flu and Dairy, Answered
item.description: Federal officials will soon begin testing the country’s milk supply for the virus. Here’s what to know.

item.title: Man Who Kidnapped Woman From Bloomberg’s Colorado Ranch Gets 22 Years in Prison
item.description: Joseph Beecher was intent on killing the media mogul and inquired about his family before taking a housekeeper hostage, officials said.

item.title: Notre-Dame Cathedral in Paris Reopens After 2019 Fire: What to Know
item.description: Millions of visitors will flock to the Parisian cathedral after it reopens in December for the first time since a destructive fire in 2019.

item.title: A judge who served in the military for over 20 years upholds use of race in Naval Academy admissions, citing national security
item.description: Judge Richard Bennett wrote that the school had “established a compelling national security interest in a diverse officer corps.”

item.title: The incredible health benefits of drinking enough water: New study highlights role in weight loss, migraines, and more
item.description: Researchers also found that adequate hydration can control diabetes, blood glucose levels, and low blood pressure.

item.title: Security companies are getting slammed with calls after the killing of UnitedHealthcare’s CEO
Iran Accelerates Production of Near-Bomb-Grade Uranium, IAEA Says
item.description: The United Nations chief inspector says production has quadrupled. But it is not clear whether Iran is trying to touch off a crisis or gather bargaini...

item.title: Iran Begins to Evacuate Military Officials and Personnel From Syria
item.description: The withdrawals by one of President Bashar al-Assad’s key backers come amid a resurgent rebel offensive.

item.title: The killing of a top health care executive has set the business world on edge as police search for answers
item.description: The CEO of UnitedHealthcare, Brian Thompson, was gunned down early Wednesday morning.

item.title: Live Updates: South Korea’s President Apologizes, but Doesn’t Resign Ahead of Impeachment Vote
item.description: President Yoon Suk Yeol said he would not seek to impose martial law again and that he would leave his fate to his party. Lawmakers will vote on wheth...

item.title: Iran Begins to Evacuate Military Officials and Personnel From Syria
item.description: The withdrawals by one of President Bashar al-Assad’s key backers come amid a resurgent rebel offensive.

item.title: Trump Still Faces 8 Civil Lawsuits Over the Jan. 6 Attack
item.description: Donald J. Trump has successfully defeated or impeded many legal challenges against him over the storming of the Capitol, but eight lawsuits on the mat...

item.title: USDA orders nationwide testing of milk for bird flu to contain and eventually eliminate the virus
item.description: Dairy farmers and processors across the U.S. have been reluctant to test animals or milk for the virus, fearing economic or other repercussions.
